name: Classic Cookbooks: Scalloped Salmon
description: When I read an older cookbook, I am drawn to the recipes that sound a little funny and old-fashioned: stuffed breast of veal, pork chops flambé, Indian pudding. I’m pleased to say that not once did this method lead me...
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 cups coarse cracker crumbs (I used panko)

recipeInstructions.text: He says to remove all skin and bones from the salmon, but I am lazy and the skin and bones are edible and good for you, so I left them in. Flake the salmon and combine with the crumbs and chopped vegetables. Season with salt and pepper and then stir in the melted butter and beaten eggs. Pour into a buttered 9 x 13 inch casserole and dot the top with more butter. Bake in a 375°F oven for 30 minutes.
